definition: a change of the form or nature of a thing or person into a completely different one
sentence: The caterpillar underwent a metamorphosis, emerging as a beautiful butterfly.

definition: a characteristic, habit, or mannerism that is peculiar to an individual
sentence: His idiosyncrasy of wearing mismatched socks became a trademark of his style.

definition: a typical example or pattern of something; a model
sentence: The new research provides a paradigm shift in our understanding of the disease.

definition: a sentimental longing for the past
sentence: Listening to that song filled her with nostalgia for her childhood.

definition: a contrast or opposition between two things
sentence: Her carefree attitude was the antithesis of his serious demeanor.

definition: the belief in or practice of disinterested and selfless concern for the well-being of others
sentence: His altruism was evident in all the volunteer work he did.

definition: to summarize and state again the main points
sentence: The professor recapitulated the lecture in the final minutes of the class.
He felt a strong antipathy toward the policies of the administration.

definition: a thing belonging or appropriate to a period other than that in which it exists
sentence: The use of a smartphone in a historical film was a glaring anachronism.

definition: to turn into bone or bony tissue; to become rigid or fixed in pattern
sentence: As opinions ossify, it becomes difficult to implement change.
